intro: Euploca brachythrix, commonly known as the narrow-leaved euploca, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and ecological research.
